      • loadAltitudes

        public void loadAltitudes()
        This function loads the 9 altitudes into the altidude combobox on the form.

      • loadAirports

        public void loadAirports()
        This function is loads the airports from the winds aloft webpage and puts them in the airport combobox on the form

      • setComboBox

        public javax.swing.JComboBox setComboBox(int fmLeft,
                                int fmTop,
                                java.lang.String[] strArray)
        This function is used by the constructor to create and position the airport and altitude ComboBoxes on the frame
        Parameters:
        fmLeft - an integer representing the number of pixels from the left of the frame
        fmTop - an integer representing the number of pixels from the top of the frame
        strArray - an array of strings representing the contents of the ComboBox list
        Returns:
        cbo a JComboBox object that is positioned on the panel

      • setTextField

        public javax.swing.JTextField setTextField(int fmLeft,
                                  int fmTop,
                                  java.lang.String strVar)
        This function is used by the constructor to create and position the wind direction, speed, and temperature text fields on the frame
        Parameters:
        fmLeft - an integer representing the number of pixels from the left of the frame
        fmTop - an integer representing the number of pixels from the top of the frame
        strVar - a string object representing the contents that will be placed in the text field
        Returns:
        TextField a JTextField object that will contain weather information

      • setLabel

        public javax.swing.JLabel setLabel(int fmLeft,
                          int fmTop,
                          java.lang.String strVar)
        This function is used by the constructor to create and position all the various small labels on the frame
        Parameters:
        fmLeft - an integer representing the number of pixels from the left of the frame
        fmTop - an integer representing the number of pixels from the top of the frame
        strVar - a string object representing the contents that will be placed in the label
        Returns:
        label a JLabel object to label the components of the frame

      • updateTextBoxes

        public void updateTextBoxes(int strIndex,
                   java.lang.String strAlt)
        This function is called whenever an a combobox item is selected. It makes sure that two combobox items, airport ID and altitude, must be selected in order for the wind direction, speed, and temperature text fields to update with correct weather information
        Parameters:
        strIndex - an integer representing the index of the ariport in the airport ComboBox.
        strAlt - a 2 character string representing the weather altitude in thousands of feet.
